channel.title: Project Insanity Welcome Message Help
channel.description: Hey guys, I'm working on a project insanity based server, and I'm trying to change the welcome message. As far as I know it's the server(source)-side client.class. Here is the problem, I tried decompiling the class file, but when I try to recompile, I get 100 errors. Why can't I recompile it? It doesn't even work if there are no changes.

item.title: Project Insanity Welcome Message Help
item.dc:creator: @Anc13nts253 Anc13nts253
item.description:
@Anc13nts253 wrote:

[quote=“R4z0rb14d3, post:8, topic:373992”][quote author=JaydenD12 link=topic=469976.msg3436646#msg3436646 date=1292797868]
Are you serious?
[/quote] Apparently not. I was right to start with. I’ve been using java script for 9 hours, and have already gotten farther than you did in a week.

Okay, unfortunately I was right. So I guess it’s just me. When I compile it I get 100+ errors, even without any changes. I guess I’m just screwed. lol.[/quote]

Like they have been stating above. Edit the Conifg Class(Config.java compiles to a Config.class so edit the .java) And change the welcome message there, if you already did that. Go to Client Class(Client.java compiles to a Client.class so edit the .java)
& Just search the welcome message with “Ctfl F”. Once changed, compile your server. Make sure your welcome message stay’s inside the parenthesis. Then login.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Insanity Welcome Message Help
item.dc:creator: @R4z0rb14d3 R4z0rb14d3
item.description:
@R4z0rb14d3 wrote:

[quote=“JaydenD12, post:6, topic:373992”]Are you serious?[/quote] Apparently not. I was right to start with. I’ve been using java script for 9 hours, and have already gotten farther than you did in a week.

Okay, unfortunately I was right. So I guess it’s just me. When I compile it I get 100+ errors, even without any changes. I guess I’m just screwed. lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Insanity Welcome Message Help
item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

R4z0rb14d3:

It was my understanding that you have to change the .class files, not just the java.

You edit your client class, which is your client.java

Compiling after that edits the client.class file automatically.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Insanity Welcome Message Help
item.dc:creator: @R4z0rb14d3 R4z0rb14d3
item.description:
@R4z0rb14d3 wrote:

Thanks for clearing the location and what-not up, as well as the correction in my vocabulary.

However, my problem remains. In the src, are the java files, Am I supposed to edit them, and then compile them?

Read full topic

item.title: Project Insanity Welcome Message Help
item.dc:creator: @R4z0rb14d3 R4z0rb14d3
item.description:
@R4z0rb14d3 wrote:

It was my understanding that you have to change the .class files, not just the java.

item.title: Project Insanity Welcome Message Help
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

smkscape:

config class, if not there then just client class…

This.
You don’t need to decompile in the first place. The Java files are in the SRC folder.

Read full topic
